text: Hi <@UD53A9UUR>, we’ve got that working. Problem is that our designer isn’t using any template, but the D&D functionality for e-mails. So we do not have a place to store any code in the head section.

For anyone that has the same issue, please upvote this <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Add-a-place-to-add-custom-code-to-the-head-of-an-drag-and-drop-D/idi-p/467311#M88494|idea> on the forum.
<@UD53A9UUR> I get that this could cause issues if we style HTML tags directly, but the option to use classes like `.u-hide-on-mobile` combined with some styling from the head would be awesome

Hi All, fairly new to HubSpot so please bear with me here.
I have created a dev account because I would like to start playing around with the code for an email template my marketing team has created. Is there a way I can copy the email from one account to another or do I need to rebuild it in the dev account?
Hey Michael! Yes you can do that within the Design Tools <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/design-manager/copy-a-template-or-theme-to-another-HubSpot-account>
